BhBZKUQAX2wFdSPpZmUVNw.text: This is a beautiful gem! Excellent pizza, warm environment and a special group of staff. Every meal I've had here has been brilliant.

20XrG0iRbJjqerbYNYFefQ.text: Just my favourite Italian caffe`.   Coffees are delicious, imported Italian beers and wines.   All sort of food to take away available, from pizzas, to pasta, passing through calzone or little pastries.   The decoration is entirely Italian, clear reminder of the Italian busy cafes where you stop for a espresso to keep your day goingthis cafe is just the opposite, a great place to relax and enjoy the italian snack gastronomy.   You can not leave this place without trying a slice of pizza al taglio (it's actually a square portion of pizza margherita) which is by far the best one I have ever tried outside Italy. Do try it!   Particularly interesting is that the radio station they listen to is in Italian!   Nice staff but no toilets unless you ask them to let you use their personal one:S  Absolutely affordable!   Get a real taste of Italy!

PrFqm0ZsNSlygmJByWD5qA.text: This is my fave pizza place. They open late which is handy if your peckish after a few drinks in the many establishments available in the Grassmarket. The pizza slices come in squares and taste absolutely amazing.

TNrR4fhT9z1l8QR7mGC3yQ.text: I got the chicken Caesar salad. The chicken was that awful stuff that comes already cooked and chunked up from bulk suppliers. I could tell it had just been defrosted in the microwave as it was an odd temperature (not cold, not hot). The rest of the salad consisted of old lettuce and far too many croutons(which I left), slathered in a lot of sauce. The parmesan was good.  I didn't complain at the time as my parents, who were with me, were about to leave and catch a plane and I had to be back at work within a few mins. The pizza others were having looked nice but I'm not into bready, wheaty stuff in the middle of the day.   Bottom Iine: I don't expect awful chicken for a 7/8 salad.

D1ACOArrxFeiU6KpiHYCRQ.text: This is a restaurant with cozy atmosphere. The "Made In Italy" pizza is a must-have item. The pasta "spaghetti carbonara" is very creamy, added with the Parmesan cheese. You will love it if you are a fan of creamy sauce. The "spaghetti Bolognese" , the meat sauce is very good, tasty. Should try it if you come over this street .

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pasta: Spaghetti Carbonara
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pasta: Spaghetti Bolognese
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pizza: Made In Italy

vlKGuq3dwwqmW5qw5XeEFA.text: Good Italian food. Busy little restaurant with attentive and friendly staff. We order a bruschetta which was tasty but seemed to be slightly lacking some flavor (perhaps it needed more basil?), and the tomato chunks were quite large. The pizza we ordered was very tasty and having the ability to 'create your own' means you can tailor it to your own taste. This can be good and bad though - we had chicken mushroom and peppers which was tasty but seemed to be lacking something again.

XlmHAxsd-UH96YWMqL7jaA.text: Loved the pizza!! This place is authentic and tastes like it was "made in Italy". I had bad luck on my first restaurant in Edinburgh, so this was a really pleasant surprise. It's close to several bars/restaurants. Definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Made in Italy pizza is soooo delicious. I couldn&#39;t do anything else but enjoy this piece of art. At harmony.

GpW3yWQfCRd3fC2RjVQGkA.text: It was ok for a reasonably priced dinner - we had a selection of panini, pizza, and soup. Everything was good, nothing was terribly special. The carrot and coriander soup got the best reviews. However, it was quiet, the service was nice, and it was warm and toasty inside. I'm sure there is better food at Grassmarket, but everything was so crowded that it was hard to find a place to sit.

6QiP4-uBjEAXty8j4fl9SQ.text: I ordered a Calzone. I received the calzone that they forgot to put cheese in. I'm not the most complicated so I informed them and told them I was fine eating it just wanted some marinara sauce on the side. He then precedes to bring me ketchup and mayo instead of marinara. Funniest and most horrible experience ever. However, Garlic bread was bomb.

Zu5taUQwZFwA4ubxyWqmpw.text: Their Bellini salad with grilled Chicken is one of the best salads I have tasted in Edinburgh. It has some lovely sundried tomatoes, black olives, peppers as well as a balsamic dressing. A friend also usually enjoys the vegetarian Calzone, excellent value at circa 5. A great place to people watch when sitting outside in the summer with the Grassmarket Sunday market and at this time of year bands playing from the jazz festival. One negative was that outside tables now have to pay for their meal when they order. I presume that they had too many people leaving without paying - sad reflection of our society. We didn't order coffee or afters as we decided to wander elsewhere. I feel that they will ultimately lose out on the amount each person spends per meal. Time will tell.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bellini salad. Looks great.

NyCoDOJElPk1rT7d6e0_Ew.text: Made in Italy offers great food and excellent service, and is in a central location for people to grab a tasty lunch or dinner as they pass through the Grassmarket.  The restaurant has a really friendly and inviting atmosphere with lots of neatly laid out, clean tables and plenty of interesting pictures and ornaments to look at around the walls.   The staff are all warm and efficient, know the menu intricately and don't harangue you as can be the norm in some places. The menu has a great range of Italian dishes and I went for their Rigatoni Mamma Mia which had meatballs in a delicious tomato sauce.  It was served quickly and in a big, filling portion which was definitely sufficient for an evening main.  As a group we spent about 10 each altogether which we thought was an amazing deal considering how good the food was.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

trd-OYncD7K2UfL0PeOPDQ.text: I'm beginning to lose count of how many times I have walked past Made in Italy on a sunny day in Edinburghs Grass Market and thought 'Wow, that looks like a great place to go to'.  Thats because on those rare Scottish sunny days, I would forgive you for thinking you were actually in Italy - or at least thats how it felt as soon as we took the plunge and grabbed on of the quickly filling seats outside Made in Italy.  From the moment we sat down, we felt as though we were in authentic Italy - a real Italian waitress who was impossibly charming greated us and took our orders. The food was fantastic - my pizza not only being square, but thin and crispy with a delicious topping of mozzarella and vine tomatoes - yum!  The coffee we then moved onto - we were reliably informed - was award winning, what ever that means - but it did taste damn good.  Overall, the experience was of like a small slice of Italy being placed in Edinburgh - and the weather brought with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Made in Italy

QbC5tY7qGZD9k13R0E5NdA.text: The food was okay, service was almost non existent but the prices can't be beat!  The pizzas didn't look good so I went for the veggie calzone - wasn't so bad. They do have outdoor seating. It can get a bit chaotic siting inside.

Jk30lX8TdUurQm19ffigfQ.text: /siren/ tourist trap, tourist trap /siren/  Consider yourself warned.  Food was at best mediocre, I ordered the chicken caesar salad, the lettuce did not contain any green leaves but more of yellow.  I also found two "hearts"/stumps, where the meristem originates from the plant.  i.e. the hard part that you do not eat.  My pizza was burnt edges with undercooked dough, resulting in a very interesting experience as i tried to saw through it, flinging toppings across the table.    after trying to signal the waitress for our bill, gave up after 15 minutes and went up to the front to pay for it.  I heard and saw several other customers faced with the same problem.  This was a 3 o'clock, arguably well past lunch hour rush.

ctr-9UHM6eyeUydjXTgVog.text: The food here is excellent, but it struggles sometimes when it gets busy. Normally you don't have to wait too long, but the last time I went in (during the festival) it was absolutely rammed, and it was quite a long wait for the food. To be fair this is because with the pizzas the dough is made fresh so takes a bit of time, but if you're in a rush then it'll be tight.   The food is excellent, I had a pizza with king prawns, garlic, onion and sun-dried tomatoes and my friend had basically every meat you could imagine. His was amazing and mine was really good, but I was a bit disappointed by the lack of prawns (only 6 on a 12 inch pizza). They have a range of pizzas and pastas and a create your own pizza option all at good prices. The service is efficient and friendly and it's generally a really good eating experience.

ZU4-dtIKr4DfXf6phfbpCA.text: This quaint cafe in Grassmarket is best enjoyed on one of those rare sunny days! It's one of many cafes in a row, and on days like today, where I was just there for lunch, it can feel like you're on holiday, sitting somewhere in a southern European piazza. They serve antipasti, pasta and pizza dishes as well as paninis, desserts and ice creams! I would definitely recommend the Veneto Panini, a fantastic dish of chicken, pesto, mozzarella and olives, which I think is priced pretty fairly. I'm also a big fan of their ice creams. I've had a meat calzone here, which wasn't on my top ten calzone list, but it was alright. Great place to sit outdoors on a sunny, lazy afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Dlvn_8JiLrhUPbW30UoX_Q.text: Grassmarket is full of great little shops, boutiques and places to eat.  One of these is Made in Italy, which looks onto the small square in the centre of the area.  In a city that is full of Italian eateries of various kinds, it can be hard to stand out from the crowd.  So here goes with my verdict of Made in Italy.  Like Jonathan, I had walked past this place a few times before going into it.  I went in for lunch, and sampled one of their pizzas.  It was a pretty good pizza, all told, and the Grassmarket relaxed ambience merely added to the feeling of enjoyment.  Whilst it maybe doesn't compare to a Zizzi or Pizza Express, it was still very good for what it was.  I would be prepared to go back here if I was in the area; it's perhaps not the sort of place I would travel a distance to eat at.

GgIbRs1HGifdy5CuecwC9A.text: Urgh, went there for a quick dinner, having read decent reviews here but despite fairly good service, the food was really not great.  I had pasta in a weak, watery tomato based sauce, my company had a fairly average lasagne.  On the plus side this place was fairly cheap but, as with most things, you get what you pay for.  Try Gusto on George Street for a superior (an more expensive!) Italian experience.

rh2AO9aRHWkSgp4xLoArTA.text: This is my absolute favourite Italian restaurant in Edinburgh, though I only discovered it years after moving here. It somehow maintains an air of mystique, a unique quality almost as though you're an insider for knowing about it, even though it's located right in the middle of the busy Grassmarket.   The food here is top-notch, with hefty portions and low prices. They do student discounts and it's open until two in the morning, so you can come here for a stromboli after hitting the many nearby pubs.   I'm almost too jealous to review it positively, because I don't want anyone but me to come here!

5IN8cw3BrtqaDXUfzEDuCg.text: One of the slightly cheaper places on the grassmarket where you can sit outside. We settled on this place because it had cheap food and my brother could get a beer. But there are real good and bad points.  We had a pizza slice each, at less than 2 each these are a real bargain. You can chose your toppings, I went for mushrooms and sun blush tomatoes, bro went for mushrooms and black olives. The base is really quite thick and spongy, like a deep pan pizza so not for the thin crust lovers! But it was good and filling and we scoffed them down! Service is ok but we were told to pay before we'd even been brought our drinks which I think is pretty outrageous! My brother challenged them on it, asking if they thought we were going to run off and she replied "it happens". The price of his small bottle of beer was also an incredible 4.50 which we had not expected. We were not offered fresh parmesan or black pepper and so helped ourselves. the waiter didn't like this and gave us some filthy looks as if we were going to steal it, or maybe just his job! I had an after dinner cappuccino and it was fine, not amazing, not awful, just average. I think that pretty much sums this place up to be honest.

3fgNQCGoYzAbtwT8fFuBVA.text: One star for the service, rude, pushy and asked us the pay within moments of delivering food and getting the order wrong. Food is good, but not good enough to make up for the attitude.

w8MjkPQw3anDFUBoklfmuw.text: THis little cafe has had a bit of a make over in the last year and has lost a little of its old world charm however, they do still make the best cappucino in Edinburgh, in my opinion. Now that the work in the Grassmarket is nearly complete it will become much more pleasant to sit in their increased outside terrace space.  Inside, they usually have the Italian radio playing so you can pretend that you are in sunny italy and not in rainy Edinburgh. Wide range of italian snacks, traditional pizza, folded over pizza and some more substantial meals. Also a good range of italian cakes and biscuits, although they have sadly stopped stocking the very traditional italian plain lemon cake which used to be my favourite with a morning cappucino.   A good spot for a coffee if you are early for your class at Dance Base and also a good spot for a bit to eat after browsing the shops in the Grassmarket.

ZsHOoiwCX4f9118UzoeEuw.text: I tend to avoid Italian restaurants because I feel like I can replicate pizza and past in my own kitchen. Not this place however, there is no way I can cook up what they served. This is the best Italian I've ever had and I highly recommend you visit.

8WqQxKC72PFqhpgfH7zdcA.text: So, we went there around 8:30. It was very convenient to where our hotel is but also near the Edinburgh Castle so still very busy. We were told that there was no dining inside left for the rest of the evening and we can sit outside if we wanted. We decided to since we were so hungry and it was late. Our server took awhile to bring out for the water and finally we got to order. Very slow!! I wouldn't typically be so impatient but at this point it was 9pm and we had to sit outside and it was 45. Finally when I couldn't bare it anymore, we were grabbed to come inside when they had an open table. We had ordered while we were outside. We got the garlic cheese bread to start and I got seafood pasta.   Since the food took awhile, we luckily didn't get it until we were warm inside.   The food was delicious. The seafood in my past was all huge - the mussels and the shrimp. Even though the service was slow - our server was extremely friendly. And I'm glad I was able to enjoy the food in warmth.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Garlic Cheese bread
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seafood pasta

Bcw2FYOjzDE4YXplOGRSYA.text: Not lucky! Almost one hour for a pizza?  Spaghetti arraived warm after staying around 5min in the balcony. We could see it....

diob7K2A3J_vDbFFMVoLQg.text: This place was packed on a Friday night, but it was rather frustrating for our 2 person table to be ignored. People who came long after us got their food first. It took over an hour to get our appetizer salads, and about 40 more minutes to get our two 10-inch pizzas. The big upside: all of the food was absolutely incredible. My starter salad consisted of only rocket greens, generous shavings of parmigiana reggiano, and luscious balsamic vinegar, and it was fantastic. I had the four cheese pizza, and the cheese was fresh and bountiful, the dough perfection. My husband was likewise impressed by the food. That said, I wouldn't go there again based on their service.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. meat pizza
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. four cheese pizza
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. salad

rCDZTTlZFQ7chIrtTuTHlw.text: After a long day of walking around and being tourist we stumbled upon this delicious spot. The smell is what seduced us to walk in. Truly glad we did. I had the lasagne which was hands down one of the best lasagnas I have ever had. We ordered garlic bread for the table, which had us fighting over the last piece. I also had an Irish coffee that was great. It was my favorite meal during our entire trip to Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

xtDonqBtCKw9iVLNheVk0Q.text: First time eating here! Was a great atmosphere, although a bit cozy, but reasonable considering this is a touristy block. The food was excellent and definitely tasted loyal to Italy (based on my limited knowledge). My wife and I had the Spaghetti Carbonara and it was fantastic. Would recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Spaghetti Carbonara

n1aIO71RkCp-TDakOFttnw.text: In our mission to find the best hot chocolate in the UK, we have definitely found the place. I mean, yes, the pizza and the pasta we got were also very delicious, but the hot chocolate!! It was flavorful and sweet, not like the watery and bitter ones we've had. Very delicious.

VEcaanWCGkMAKr5_Opyb-A.text: We came here 3 out of the 5 nights that we stayed! The wait staff was super friendly and the pasta was delicious. The sandwich that we ordered the first night was like a grilled cheese sandwich with ham. The rest of the nights we ordered pasta and pizza; it was scrumptious. We were seated right away even though it was crowded, they squeezed us in. This is a very good restaurant and I highly recommend to anyone that likes pasta and/or Pizza. They also had good salads.

vfBxiuIEO65LaN3L4VYTAg.text: Quite a pleasant fast-pizzeria :) Their staff is very helpful and diligent, but we had already eaten - we only asked for a snack - perhaps some cheese or Italian sausages to have them with our beer, but they weren t able to serve us anything like that. So, we had just beer and the children contented themselves with some lemonade :)  Vcelku sympaticka rychlopizzerie :) Velmi ochotny a snazivy personal, ale my uz byli po jidle - chteli jsme jen talir se syrem, nebo italskou uzeninou jako dobani pod pivo, ale to nam vytvorit neumeli. Tak jsme si dali jen pivo a mrnata limonadu :)

JaHubI46TJNGo6O_nWUvXw.text: On my third trip to Edinburgh from the US,  my family and I stumbled upon this little gem in the middle of Grassmarket and it quick became our favorite go to for breakfast and lunch.  The service is excellent and very friendly and they have wonderful pastries and pizza.  Also,  the espresso was excellent!  If you are in Edinburgh you must stop in and enjoy a bite to eat or just a cup of coffee.  You won't regret it!

kEs5wKRPyAhvWbQFi0vNWg.text: Stopped by here for a quick walk in breakfast.   Prices are are right and coffee is good.  Traditional pastries and breakfast options.  Came back and grabbed a sandwich while walking through the market place.    Friendly staff behind the counter and good food

xOPOyzh5CE0IyghhXscm5A.text: I was very disappointed.  We were sat quickly but were not told food was taking over 45 min once you ordered.  We ordered a pre-made Stromboli and panini.  Took over 45 min to deliver.  The table next to us got up and walked out before their food came, they had been waiting for over an hour since ordering for their food to come to the table.  Underwhelmed by the food quality.  Asked for a side of marinara, it was cold.  They have such potential to be good but didn't deliver

aWBwIRDw1TQfNG4IpbpGmA.text: OK pizza place with a maybe a dozen tables inside and an extensive patio as part of the Grassmarket restaurant strip. My margherita pizza was just fine. This place feels quite authentic with quite a few Italian staff. Stromboli and pizza slices available if you are in a hurry, plus the option to build your own pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

won-xWaF5jN8L1tGqyW8Kg.text: Offered gluten free penne noodles for their pasta dishes. Very good portions. I had a panini and was completely stuffed afterwards. Not a ton of seating but delicious food. Was a wonderful late lunch for hungry tourist travelers.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. cute sign outside &#34;coffee is always a good idea&#34;
Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. mid lunch, panini and pasta dishes

Tb_gixqFsPhtcS2D3HrmcQ.text: Ate here after a 12 hour tour we took of the Scottish highlands. We wanted a not as expensive dinner, being students and all, and we're not disappointed with this meal.  My friend had a pizza panini that she raves about and I had a "create your own slice" which was HUGE AND DELICIOUS. Great place with great staff and great food. Highly recommended!!

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Create your own pizza with chicken, tomato slices, and sundries tomato. Covered in cheese. Yum!

OgP08jGOTv6ebPWgysR04w.text: Very taste and authentic pizza.  The service was good and the environment was average.  I recommend getting there early because there was a queue while we were there.

OJ1Q2LszxnGFBlTTss2nsQ.text: I was looking for something other than traditional Scottish food and came upon this gem! A small place (maybe 10-12 tables?) with a patio. It was extremely busy and the manager told me I could sit outside, even though it was terrible weather.   I really wanted some italian food at this point so I agreed to sit outside, but a few minutes later the manager came back, he had managed to squeeze me inside! Very pleased.   Though he warned me that the kitchen was very busy, he brought me a glass a wine asap (which was delicious) and the food ended up coming within 20 minutes. I ordered the spaghetti bolognese and it was fantastic, especially with the wine.   The serving staff were very friendly, I didn't feel awkward at all eating alone. I highly recommend this place!

_VUmv9CYwikUOoae0R8dIg.text: To start off, this place has great service! Our waiter recommended what to get and was really kind. We ordered a pizza and can't complain. Would recommend for a quick meal.

ejRHDv-k-30Dgb_pjAvumA.text: Fantastic food, very attentive and friendly staff. Good drinks list and well served beer. Food is clean and fresh and very well priced for area. Will deffo be back

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A rare sunny day in Scotland

LjVwJvCKH3hfM4C-yiOmXA.text: Slow service (1+ hour wait for lasagna and a pizza). Okay pizza but bland lasagna. Staff was friendly but obviously messed up on getting the order placed in time. Won't be returning.

AMKBo7-BgUHUTZMTVhD_9A.text: Amazing pizza. Tried them out on a whim after 24 hours of travel, the perfect meal! Fast and courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of Made In Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bella Vita Pizza - soooo delicious!
